item.title: Elden Ring Nightreign's Absence On the Switch 2 Is a Double-Edged Sword
item.description:
The Nintendo Switch 2 is shaping up to be a boon for Nintendo when it comes to third-party games. The first Switch, much like the Wii and Wii U before it, skipped a number of high-profile AAA games from the previous and current console generations, including Elden Ring , Cyberpunk , and Red Dead Redemption 2 —even best-selling eighth-generation games, like GTA 5 , were never made available on Nintendo's hybrid device.

But that's likely to change in the coming months and years, as Nintendo has confirmed that several heavy-hitters will be getting ported to the Switch 2. While the arrival of titles like Elden Ring is sure to please Nintendo fans, the absence of other flagship releases, most notably Elden Ring Nightreign , is a bit puzzling. After all, if the Switch 2 is good enough to run Elden Ring and Cyberpunk 2077 , it should be more than capable of handling Nightreign . What's more is that the Switch 2 is getting its very own FromSoftware PvPvE game in the form of the console-exclusive The Duskbloods . While it may seem strange for Nintendo to offer the latter and not the former, it actually makes a good bit of sense. But whether this is beneficial for consumers remains to be seen.

The Pros and Cons of Elden Ring Nightreign Skipping the Switch 2

Switch 2 Loyalists Will Miss Out On 2025's Flagship FromSoftware Release

The average gamer can only afford one console at a time, so those who have chosen Nintendo as their de-facto gaming company may be disappointed to learn that they'll not be able to play Elden Ring Nightreign . It seems a bit like a half-victory: Elden Ring itself will finally be available for Nintendo fans, but the newer, cooperative spin-off of the game won't be. In other words, Switch 2 owners will still be behind the rest of the gaming community when it comes to FromSoftware games, just slightly less so.

Of course, there's a fairly plausible reason for this: Nintendo doesn't want Elden Ring Nightreign to cut into the success of The Duskbloods . Time will tell just how similar Duskbloods is to Nightreign , but they are both FromSoftware action games with a hefty dose of cooperative gameplay, so they will definitely have a lot of overlap in terms of target audience. Nintendo likely paid a pretty penny for the chance to publish Duskbloods exclusively on its next console, so it would make sense to avoid releasing another high-profile game that could cannibalize its sales.

Nightreign might come to the Switch 2 at a later date, but with The Duskbloods launching in 2026, that seems somewhat unlikely, assuming the above theory is accurate.

The Duskbloods Will Be Far More Active Without Nightreign's Interference

Multiplayer games live and die on the back of their playerbase, which is a big reason why so many of them fail: without enough players to connect with, there's no real way to engage with the game's core systems. This applies to both Nightreign and The Duskbloods as, despite allowing solo play, they seem to heavily lean on their cooperative elements, as these set them apart from previous FromSoftware titles.

With this in mind, The Duskbloods might actually be better off without Nightreign luring away its players. Switch 2 owners can rest assured that they'll have a wide range of Duskblood s players to fight with or against at any given time, as the game's community will naturally be more densely populated under the given circumstances. Of course, Elden Ring Nightreign could be considerably better than The Duskbloods , which would make this point somewhat moot, but the opposite could be true as well, so audiences will just have to wait and see.

item.title: Cyberpunk 2077: Best Weapons For Sandevistan Builds
item.description:
The Sandevistan is easily one of the most overpowered pieces of cyberware that eurodollars can buy in Cyberpunk 2077 , and it’s something that Adam Smasher uses to conquer the competition. Now, V can wear their own version of the Sandevistan, in which they can slow time and still enjoy rapid reflexes to unleash deadly attacks before their enemies can even blink.

Sandevistans are so much fun in Cyberpunk 2077 , which is why it’s going to help players to know what the best weapons to use will be while in this slowed reality, ensuring that every bullet does its job, and every melee hit works its magic.

8 Archangel

Fully Automatic Revolver with Great Headshot Damage

Type

Power

Attack Speed

1.9

Damage

115

Reload Speed

0.9

Effective Range

42

Weapon Handling

4.5

Magazine Size

6

Effects

  • +200% Headshot Damage Multiplier
  • +25% Armor Penetration
  • +20% Shock Chance

Iconic Modifier

Full-auto mode allows you to fire rounds in the rhythm of Samurai's "Archangel". Successive hits after short intervals knock enemies to the ground.

Attachments

  • Scope

  • How to get Archangel: Complete Kerry Eurodyne's mission, A Like Supreme.

Revolvers are one of the coolest weapon types in Cyberpunk 2077 , and although guns aren’t the greatest weapon types to use with a Sandevistan due to how the bullets don’t travel that far unless they’re practically already set to go off in someone’s face, the Archangel does help somewhat with that due to its full auto spread and ability to knock enemies to the ground with successful hits.

This means that those who want to represent Kerry Eurodyne can do so with Archangel, a weapon that has exceptional headshot damage, along with fast-firing rounds so that players can line up bullets across multiple enemies during a Sandevistan burst, so that when time returns to normal, enemies are going to be pulverized by lead.

7 Agaou

A Thrown Axe to Emit Painful Shockwaves

Attack Speed

2.2

Damage Per Hit

132

Stamina Cost

8

Effective Range

20

Return Time

13

Effects

  • +125% Headshot Damage Multiplier
  • +25% Armor Penetration
  • +30% Shock Chance

Iconic Modifier

Crit Hits with throws emit a shockwave that can damage multiple enemies.

  • How to Get Agagou: Obtained from Ayo Zarin in the Increased Criminal Activity: Voodoo Boys, found in Luxor High Wellness Spa, Dogtown.

With a fast swing, the Agagou axe makes for a slashingly good time against opponents thanks to how V can swing it wildly into enemies that are too slow to respond to the Sandevistan’s slowing time. The Agaou axe also benefits from its unique perk, in which throwing it at an enemy’s crit spot will grant a surge of shockwaves that can damage multiple enemies at once.

With that in mind, players can throw Agaou at an enemy from close range, to both grab the shockwave effect and return the axe, only to do it again during a period of time-slow. Melee weapons are great for the Sandevistan, and Agaou’s electric capabilities prove just that.

6 Comrade’s Hammer

Fire Explosive Rounds That Reload with Quick Melee Attacks

Type

Tech

Attack Speed

1.7

Damage

442

Reload Speed

1.7

Effective Range

30

Weapon Handling

2.7

Magazine Size

1

Effects

  • +75% Armor Penetration
  • 1 sec Charge Time
  • +50% Crit Damage
  • +40% Burn Chance
  • Fires explosive rounds, but cannot penetrate cover

Iconic Modifier

The cylinder has been modified to hold a single explosive round capable of wreaking utter destruction. Automatically reloads when you perform a Quick Melee Attack.

  • How to get Comrade's Hammer: Obtained from a Crafting Spec looted from Darius Miles in the Suspected Organized Crime Activity found in Hargreaves Street, Arroyo, Santo Domingo.

Comrade’s Hammer is perhaps the hardest-hitting revolver that players can get in Cyberpunk 2077 , making it a must-have not only for the cool factor, for the immense damage it is capable of when it comes to halting time with a Sandevistan. While bullets don’t travel far, if at all, during Sandevistan’s time stoppage, Comrade’s Hammer hits hard enough to negate it somewhat for those at close range.

This means that players can fire off an explosive shot directly into an enemy, then use the Quick Melee Attack on another enemy to get the bullet back, just to fire it off again and repeat until time returns to normal and players are standing in a pool of exploded limbs.

5 Butcher’s Cleaver

Make Enemies Bleed to Cut Them Into Rapid Pieces

Attack Speed

1.8

Damage Per Hit

201

Stamina Cost

8

Effects

  • +25% Armor Penetration
  • +20% Bleeding Chance

Iconic Modifier

When your enemy is bleeding, the cleaver attacks faster and uses less stamina.

  • How to Get Butcher's Cleaver: Picked up from Rolland's Butcher Shop where Placide is butchering a chicken in M'ap Tann Pelen.

The Butcher’s Knife is a rare weapon indeed, and a constant reminder of the Voodoo Boys, but that doesn’t mean it shouldn’t be wielded against them. With the Butcher’s Cleaver, players will have access to an extremely fun weapon that synergizes so well with its iconic modifier to allow faster attacks and less stamina consumed, but only if enemies are bleeding.

The Butcher’s Cleaver has a 20% chance to make someone bleed with every attack, and if that enemy is bleeding during the Sandevistan’s activation, players can swing even faster than before, ensuring a thousand cuts into each enemy before they realize that they’re missing limbs.

4 Guts

A Heavy Yet Pulverising Shotgun

Type

Power

Attack Speed

0.8

Damage

421

Reload Speed

0.8

Effective Range

12

Weapon Handling

2.5

Magazine Size

6

Effects

  • +85% Headshot Damage Multiplier
  • +75% Armor Penetration
  • 20 Number of projectiles
  • Slightly reduces movement speed and jump height

Iconic Modifiers

Shoot faster, deal more damage... accuracy be damned.

  • How to get Guts: Found within the Memorial Park in City Center, within the bushes near to praying monks.

Guts was once Rebecca’s shotgun, a small woman with a true style for brutality when she was part of the Edgerunners crew. While Rebecca might not be with Night City anymore, her weapon certainly is, and V needs to wield this at least once to see true power in the palms of their hands, considering this heavy shotgun will unleash an absolutely brutal burst of pellets to rip heads clean off of necks.

While Guts is a slowed weapon due to its weight, the activation of the Sandevistan means that players can quickly get to opponents, line up a close-range headshot to enjoy the damage multiplier and extreme damage potential, just to chain to the next one until heads pop and blow.

3 Byakko

Leap Towards Enemies for Rapid Attacks

Attack Speed

2.1

Damage Per Hit

117

Stamina Cost

6.4

Effects

  • +25% Armor Penetration
  • +30% Bleeding Chance

Iconic Modifier

Allows you to leap toward an enemy with full force. Killing them allows you to temporarily perform a rapid combo of attacks.

  • How to Get Byakko: Complete all 8 of Wakako Okada's Gigs

Byakko is easily one of the best katanas in Cyberpunk 2077 , and with its iconic modifiers, players are in for a great time ahead as they activate the Sandevistan and prepare to slash the limbs off of their enemies with ease. Byakko benefits from fast flurries of attacks, which is perfect when one considers the attack speed, damage, and the ability to leap toward enemies at full force.

With enemies unable to move much during the Sandevistan’s activation, using Byakko means players can rapidly chain attacks by leaping towards their victims, slashing them for a bit, gaining a temporary surge of rapid combo attacks for the next enemy, and creating a domino effect of bloody death.

2 Scalpel

Increase Bleeding and Crit Chance During Sandevistan Activations

Attack Speed

2.1

Damage Per Hit

117

Stamina Cost

6.4

Effects

  • +25% Armor Penetration
  • +30% Shock Chance

Iconic Modifier

While Sandevistan is active, increases Crit Chance by 50% and hits apply Bleeding.

  • How to Get Scalpel: Complete the Big in Japan Side Job

Scalpel is a beautiful katana, but it’s also one that’s practically built for the Sandevistan. This weapon is a fast striking katana, and a hard-hitting one, but it’s one that practically needs the Sandevistan to truly unlock its potential. With the Scalpel, players are going to enjoy an increase to Crit Chance by a whopping 50%, which doesn’t even include the already 30% Shock Chance to make sure that the elements are truly against each of V’s victims.

Each hit with the Scalpel will also apply Bleeding, ensuring that enemies have no chance of escaping alive once V activates the Sandevistan, providing a weapon and a cyberware combo that even Adam Smasher might get a tad nervous about.

1 Sovereign

A Double-Barrel Shotgun Created for Point-Blank Shots

Type

Power Double-Barrel

Attack Speed

5

Damage

209

Reload Speed

1

Effective Range

8

Weapon Handling

2.7

Magazine Size

2

Effects

  • +85% Headshot Damage Multiplier
  • +75% Armor Penetration
  • +6% Burn Chance
  • 6 Number of projectiles

Iconic Modifiers

Guaranteed Crit Hits with point-blank shots. Increased reload speed and movement speed after shooting an enemy in the torso.

  • How to get Sovereign: Crafting Spec from Shinobu Amai in Suspected Organized Crime Activity: Modern Labor Market, found in Willow Street, Japantown, Westbrook.

If players like to get a tad sadistic with their kills, then Sovereign might be just what they are looking for. With this double-barrelled shotgun at the ready, players can approach their enemies and fire off a point-blank shot that will always be a guaranteed critical hit. Even better, is that a torso shot provides an increase to movement speed and reload speed, making the Sandevistan work even better than before.

Sure, melee weapons might be the smarter choice for the Sandevistan, but why not have some gory fun with Sovereign and blow out torsos and heads, just to rapidly rush to the next target and do it all over again?

item.title: Destiny 2 Players Are Already Sharing Marathon Fashion
item.description:
Summary

  • Destiny 2 players exhibit enthusiasm for Bungie's new game, Marathon, by recreating characters in-game.
  • The subculture of in-game fashion within Destiny 2 allows players to creatively express themselves.

Destiny 2 players are sharing their in-game fashion based on Bungie's newest title Marathon , in the wake of the extraction shooter's recent gameplay reveal. Excitement has blown up for Bungie's next game, with Destiny 2 players wasting no time in showcasing their enthusiasm.

In-game fashion has been a growing subculture in Destiny 2 for a while now. As Bungie has added more cosmetic items for players to use, the possibility to recreate favorite characters from other franchises has increased. There was even one Destiny 2 player who shared their shockingly accurate Doom: The Dark Ages fashion. It's always interesting to see how creative players can be, and with more cosmetics still being added to Destiny 2 , there's no sign of this scene slowing down any time soon.

After Marathon 's recent gameplay reveal, many gamers have taken to Reddit to showcase their recreations of the game's Runners. Three of the four playable Runners, Glitch, Locus, and Blackbird, were created by user JaxiPup, while the final Runner, Void, was brought to life by a user called iixVanquishxX. All four creations are extremely cool and do a great job of capturing the vibe of each Marathon character. Some even suggested that a Destiny 2 and Marathon collaboration would be a great addition, and considering Bungie is the developer of both, it's not out of the realm of possibility.

Destiny 2 Players Show What a Marathon Collab Could Look Like

Both posts included all the Destiny 2 ornaments and armor pieces that players need to use in order to recreate these Marathon Runners for themselves. The speed at which these have been created is already very impressive, and it's possible that others may iterate further on them as more time passes.

Despite being almost eight years old at this point, Bungie continues to release new Destiny 2 updates with fresh content for players to enjoy. More expansions for the game are planned in the future, confirming that Bungie isn't set to abandon the game any time soon. There has yet to be any news on a Destiny 2 sequel yet, with Bungie remaining tight-lipped about the overall future of the franchise.

item.title: 8 Best Games About Friendship, Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • Games like A Way Out, Titanfall 2, and Persona 4 masterfully integrate themes of friendship into gameplay and storytelling.
  • The emotional depth of friendships in games like Danganronpa and Mass Effect 2 enhances the narrative and player experience.
  • Titles such as Undertale and Pyre offer unique gameplay experiences that emphasize forming bonds with characters for compelling storytelling.

Character-driven storylines have taken over gaming, with players appreciating how fleshed-out the protagonist and their friends are in well-written games. These games will use the friendships developed in these titles to serve as the motivation for various conflicts as players try their hardest to keep these bonds intact.

The best video games around know how to use the themes of friendship to augment both gameplay and storytelling, turning these titles into must-plays in the eyes of many. If players want to enjoy a great and impactful bond in their games, then these titles will be right up their alley.

Games will be ranked based on how important themes of friendship are to the core experience.

8 A Way Out

The Bond Between The Characters Plays A Huge Role In The Gameplay

Your comment has not been saved

A Way Out
6.7 /10
OpenCritic Reviews
Top Critic Avg: 79 /100 Critics Rec: 69%
Released
March 23, 2018

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION

Hazelight Studios
Platform(s)
PC, PS4, Xbox One
OpenCritic Rating
Strong
Powered by

Co-op gaming is a great way to either test or strengthen the bonds of friendship, and nowhere is this more apparent than in A Way Out . Players take on the role of two convicts who decide to team up and escape a prison, leading to a fun, action-packed adventure full of numerous engaging set pieces.

A Way Out has its issues, what with the hamfisted storytelling and some unimaginative gameplay segments, but the themes of friendship are handled brilliantly here. All of this leads to a shocking final act, where the bonds of friendship between both the characters and the players are tested in a bombastic finale.

7 Titanfall 2

Jack And BT's Bond Is Surprisingly Strong And Emotional

Titanfall 2

Most people would scoff at the idea of befriending a machine, which is what makes Titanfall 2 's campaign so special. The game is a massive improvement over its predecessor, with Respawn Entertainment showing just how strong their writing talent is.

The bond between Jack and BT grows organically, becoming the beating heart of this amazing campaign. Fans can't help but shed tears at the emotional climax, making it clear why so many players hate the fact that this game will never receive a sequel.

6 Persona 4

Even For A JRPG, The Themes Of Friendship Run Rampant In This Game

Your comment has not been saved

Persona 4
9.5 /10

July 10, 2008

WHERE TO PLAY

Developer(s)
Atlus
Platform(s)
PS2, PS4, Xbox One, Xbox Series S, Xbox Series X, Switch, PS Vita
Powered by

Almost every JRPG focuses on themes of friendship, but it's the realistic writing and engrossing dungeon design of Persona 4 that makes it such a blast to play through. Players explore various labyrinths in the TV World that are formed from the deepest insecurities of would-be victims who eventually join the party.

It helps that the Social Links, coupled with some strong writing, ensure that the bonds in Persona 4 feel stronger than ever. As one would expect, the protagonist is on the verge of defeat against the final boss, only to recall the bonds he shares with the people of Inaba as he manages to neutralize the threat of Izanami and remove the fog from Inaba once and for all.

5 Undertale

Players Are Encouraged To Form Friendships With Monsters And Embark On The Pacifist Route

Your comment has not been saved

Undertale

Undertale is one of the most charming indie games ever made, in no small part because of its imaginative gameplay and excellent writing. Interactions with other characters are both hilarious and endearing, making fans feel emotional at the end of an unforgettable experience.

This is especially true in the Pacifist Ending, where players must befriend every enemy and boss they encounter to unlock this ending path. The final fight sees players befriending an enemy who is consumed by hate, with Asriel Dreemurr eventually calming down as he realizes that he doesn't need to be alone anymore.

4 Danganronpa: Trigger Happy Havoc

The Friendly Bonds Between Characters Make The Eventual Betrayals More Emotional

Your comment has not been saved

DanganRonpa: Trigger Happy Havoc

Danganronpa is one of the best murder-mystery games players can get their hands on, in no small part because of the emotional stakes involved. A group of high schoolers are forced into a killing game where they must figure out the killer in a Class Trial or die trying, causing friendships to fracture as people start accusing each other.

To avoid this mass panic, Makoto must solve the case and uncover crucial information to eventually figure out the culprit. Despite this twisted premise, there are genuinely heartfelt moments in this title, with players having the time to spend their Free Time with other students to deepen their bond too.

3 Pyre

The Narrator Becomes Friends With Exiles, Forcing Them To Make Hard Decisions

Pyre 's novel concept makes it both a boon and a curse to bond with the Exiles stuck in purgatory. While these characters end up being valuable in the Rites, players will also sympathize with their need to return to the surface world after a point.

This can make it harrowing for players to send away their favorite characters since that will make future Rites harder to deal with. It's this unique twist on the idea of friendship that makes Pyre a blast to play through.

2 Mass Effect 2

Without Forming Friendships And Gaining A Squadmate's Loyalty, Their Life Will Be In Jeopardy At The End

Mass Effect 2 is one of the greatest video games ever made, with a reconstructed Commander Shepard being tasked with gathering a squad to deal with the Collectors. Each squadmate has a personal story that players can get invested in, compelling them to complete certain side quests to deepen their friendship.

This is a necessity if players don't want to lose their allies during the Suicide Mission since a lack of loyalty will cause certain squadmates to fall in combat. It's a nerve-wracking finale that tests the bonds between Shepard and his squadmates, leading to arguably the most emotional finale in the series.

1 Final Fantasy 15

The Bond Between The Main Cast Serves As The Heart Of This Flawed Yet Lovable Title

Your comment has not been saved

As unfinished and puzzling as Final Fantasy 15 may be, the game boasts a ton of heart and has become a fan-favorite in the eyes of many. The biggest reason why fans love Final Fantasy 15 stems from the bond shared between the main cast, with every piece of banter cementing their relationship in the eyes of players.

Noctis, Ignis, Gladio, and Prompto are four of the closest friends in Final Fantasy history, with these characters going to hell and back together. The strength of this bond is why fans can't help but weep openly at the end of a memorable experience, flawed as it may be.

item.title: The Cozy Game Genre Should Be Keeping a Close Eye on One Tales of the Shire Feature
item.description:
The so-called cozy genre has exploded in popularity throughout the last decade, and the upcoming Tales of the Shire is expected to further expand it. The Lord of the Rings spin-off purports to hone in on the magical and quaint elements of Tolkien's fantasy landscape, centering on the laidback and unflappable Hobbits.

There's a lot of promise in this concept, which is exactly what the cozy genre needs; cozy games have gotten stale in recent years, with Stardew Valley and Animal Crossing clones being a dime a dozen these days. Even though many of these games, both big and small, are well-tuned, fun, and passionately crafted, the genre can often feel rather samey, focusing on the same tropes and design trends. One Tales of the Shire mechanic that has garnered a good bit of attention online is cooking: players can gather ingredients and create dishes based on the preferences of various NPCs, inviting them over for dinner to further their relationship, which would presumably come with benefits. It's a cute and thematically relevant way to make players engage with the game's crafting and resource-gathering systems, but as always, the devil will be in the details.

Why Tales of the Shire's Cooking Systems Could Be Influential

Tales of the Shire's Cooking Promises To Be Engaging and Immersive

Featuring cooking in a game about Hobbits makes a lot of sense: the fantasy race is known to be particularly fond of eating, cooking, and bonding over a spread of home-cooked dishes. As such, Tales of the Shire will include a dedicated, multistep minigame for cooking, and making certain decisions during these minigames will impact the quality of the relevant dishes. For instance, the longer that a player spends chopping a piece of produce could impact how smooth or chunky a given dish turns out to be.

This level of interactivity is a good sign, especially since cooking in most cozy games boils down to selecting the appropriate ingredients and hitting a "cook" button, but the system's success will depend on more than just these minigames. Plainly put, Tales of the Shire 's cooking and meal-sharing framework ought to be holistic and reactive, while also encouraging players to engage with the game world organically. This appears to be the case, as some recipes will call for vague ingredients like "something bitter," requiring players to actually study the plant life of the in-game world, familiarizing themselves with it for the best possible outcome.

The preferences of NPCs should also play a big role in this system, leading to more than just a simple thumbs-up or thumbs-down reaction to player-prepared dishes. Ideally, the player's work—their successes and failures with respect to a given dish—will be recognized and interpreted by Tales of the Shire 's NPCs, leading to a nuanced and fruitful response in either a positive or negative direction. Depending on the particulars of how cooking impacts the social sim mechanics, Tales of the Shire could emerge as a genre leader.

Cooking Should Have Consequences in Tales of the Shire

Tales of the Shire will punish or reward players based on whether an NPC enjoys their food or not. For instance, if a character tells the player that they like sweet food, but the player makes a bitter dish, the NPC will react negatively. The extent to which this will impact the broader social simulation could be what makes or breaks the game's cooking-centric features: will NPCs react mildly, or more colorfully? After all, food is sacrosanct in Hobbit culture, so it wouldn't be surprising for characters to have a strong reaction to their gastronomic experiences. Perhaps different NPCs could return different degrees of rewards and consequences depending on their personality or other contextual elements, making for a multifaceted and weighty system.

6 Images
6 Images

DIGITAL

From the creative studio, Wētā Workshop, live the cosy life of a Hobbit in the wonderfully serene landscape of the Shire. Discover, decorate, and share in this idyllic corner of Middle-earth. Join friendly Hobbits and familiar faces awaiting your arrival in Tales of the Shire: A The Lord of the Rings™ Game.

Create your own Hobbit as you set forth in Bywater. Though not yet established as an official village in Hobbiton, play a part in helping the quaint town flourish. Greet comfort at the door as you decorate your own Hobbit hole, tend to your garden, fish at the clear ponds, forage wild fruits and herbs, or trade with townsfolks. Prepare homemade meals to share with fellow Hobbits and foster relationships.

With much to see and lots more to eat, enjoy days of splendor in the picturesque forests, lakes, and pastures.

Unwind in the place where what matters most are all the little things. Help bring the community together to achieve village status in Bywater. Experience delight in Tales of the Shire: A The Lord of the Rings™ Game.

PS5 Release Date
July 29, 2025
Nintendo Switch Release Date
July 29, 2025
Platform(s)
